body:
Hi @atoulme 

I wouldn't mind working on this.
Go ahead, all contributions welcome!
Feel free :)
by all means
Merry Christmas! I can revert that part snd make sure we build with 11, indeed.
It turns out I still don't have write access to the repo so can't merge.
Weird. I think there is a simple step you need to take. Try this: https://infra.apache.org/apache-github.html
I am part of the Apache org on GitHub (via adding my GitHub user to id.apache.org) but don't seem to have the role required for this repo.
Ah, worked out what it means by GitBox stuff now.  Going through that now.
Thanks for the contribution! I will merge this PR if all tests pass.

I'm not having fun with this PR, the docs build adds 9 minutes. The assemble step runs distribution assembly, which depends on the docs build, which takes 9 minutes. So now we have a massive build for no good reason. The PR fails because we check that we can build from the source distro, and that now runs the docs build, which is slow enough on Windows we time out.

There are quite a few ways to go about this, we can make the docs build optional - but then are we testing things?
We can cascade the build so docs build first, get cached, then we run assemble with the cached data so we don't do all this work.
Or we separate the distro from docs and we ship without docs. That's not a bad option if we publish docs to the website anyway.

I reached out to ask for review on the dev@ list and didn't hear back yet. I understand this part of the code has been mostly my hobby, so it makes sense folks are not familiar and hesitant to review. If I don't hear back by end of tomorrow, I'll merge this in.
Made the call and removed docs from the distribution, and now CI time is reasonable.
Fixed with #237
Sounds good - please send a patch.
Windows env fails for an unrelated reason. I need to look at fixing it. I will merge this PR for now.

the windows test failure seems unrelated 
```
Submodule 'eth-reference-tests/src/test/resources/eth2.0-tests' (https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-tests.git) registered for path 'eth-reference-tests/src/test/resources/eth2.0-tests'
Submodule 'eth2-reference-tests/src/test/resources' (https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-spec-tests.git) registered for path 'eth2-reference-tests/src/test/resources'
Cloning into 'D:/a/incubator-tuweni/incubator-tuweni/eth-reference-tests/src/test/resources/eth2.0-tests'...
Error: fatal: unable to access 'https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-tests.git/': Failed to connect to github.com port 443 after 21018 ms: Timed out
Error: fatal: clone of 'https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-tests.git' into submodule path 'D:/a/incubator-tuweni/incubator-tuweni/eth-reference-tests/src/test/resources/eth2.0-tests' failed
```
Indeed. Merging
No, this is actually wrong - closing.
Looks like you need to run spotless though. :)
Test failure is unrelated, feel free to merge and open an issue for the OOM.

It fails field testing when loaded into Besu.

I'll isolate the issue and add tests for what broke.  I think it's my compareTo optimizations for byte arrays
Done!

Thank you for the contribution!

Please run spotless. I think you can also bring in your jmh benchmarks if you want.
On my way to fix the formatting violations.

regarding the benchmarks I would prefer to add them in a separated pr, I did them quick/dirty to make sure the new code was better. so I would need some time set them properly.

Also I fixed the issues with format @atoulme 

Thanks!
Work continues over at #444 !

It largely depends on the requirements for serialisation.  In RLP a UInt64 of 0 is actually a byte string (because RLP doesn't have numbers) so is serialised as `0x`.  In JSON-RPC Quantities trim leading zeros _except_ for the zero value so 0 is represented as `0x0`. So there's isn't really one "right" answer.

> In RLP a UInt64 of 0 is actually a byte string (because RLP doesn't have numbers) so is serialised as 0x

That's fair and I can see how toShortHexString might have different requirements depending on if you want to serialize to RLP or JSON.

I would still argue trimLeadingZeros is either a misleading name or behaviour. Maybe it makes sense for the RLP scenario, but it could be more explicit about it in the name as for me that was unexpected behaviour.
Happy to close this as a non-issue since I can use `UInt64.getBytes().toQuantityHexString()` instead. I'll leave this issue open for a couple of days in case there's further comment

0x0 is not a valid hex string, its a bit of an oddity introduced by JSON-RPC. Trimming leading zeros means trimming zero bytes. 0x0 cannot have zero length, it will be interpreted as a byte array of length 1 containing a zero byte.
Thanks @atoulme I'll close this as it's clearly been considered and is intentional.
Probably will revert and push to main.
Hello,I would like to work on this, can you assign this to me and can you explain where the classes needs to be added

Sure thing. I think you need to look at `SimpleBlockchainInformation` first - see how some of the information there like chain id, genesis hash, network ID are fixed per network? Create a map of "network name" to this information, so it becomes easier to read this from config.
The java version is now implemented here: crypto/src/main/java/org/apache/tuweni/crypto/blake2bf/Blake2bfMessageDigest.java

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

@dependabot rebase

Closing as complete!
No need to implement IWANT - it's not in the original paper, I think it was added after for pub/sub. Closing.
Closing, will reopen if I see it again.
This PR was marked stale due to lack of activity. It will be closed in 14 days.
Any advice how to add licence to an arbitrary file that I read during a test?
you can add it to the rat excludes in build.gradle. See here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-tuweni/blob/main/build.gradle#L102
